comment: Smart Data Models - Solar Energy adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Energy/master/SolarEnergy/schema.json
description: A Data Model for Solar Energy generation.

contents.name: dateEnergyMeteringStarted2
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified2
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: energyGenerated
contents.comment: Energy generated over a specific time range from the energy resource corresponding to this observation.

contents.name: activePower2
contents.comment: The actual values will beconveyed by subproperties which names will be equal to the name of each of the alternating current phases: L1, L2, L3.

contents.name: current2
contents.comment: Electrical current. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase and the neutral wire: L1, L2, L3 and N.

contents.name: powerFactor2
contents.comment: Power factor for each phase. The actual values will be conveyed by one subproperty per alternating current phase: L1, L2 and L3
